item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, September 10, 2024 at 9:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. A good day to trie-hard: saving compute 1% at a time (327 points | 100 comments)
2. Another police raid in Germany (107 points | 32 comments)
3. Tutorial on Diffusion Models for Imaging and Vision (19 points | 3 comments)
4. Satellites Spotting Aircraft (85 points | 18 comments)
5. Google Illuminate: Books and papers turned into audio (233 points | 118 comments)
6. Floral formula (62 points | 4 comments)
7. Show HN: Visual DB – Web front end for your database (72 points | 27 comments)
8. Apple must pay 13B euros in back taxes, EU's top court rules (331 points | 432 comments)
9. What you can get out of a high-quality font (190 points | 59 comments)
10. Tomato64: A port of Tomato Firmware to x86_64 (69 points | 20 comments)
11. Show HN: DBOS transact – Ultra-lightweight durable execution in Python (31 points | 10 comments)
12. Debugging in the Multiverse (151 points | 49 comments)
13. The Friendship that made Google huge (28 points | 9 comments)
14. How we made Jupyter notebooks load faster (110 points | 9 comments)
15. Show HN: YourNextStore – an open-source Shopify with Stripe as the back end (135 points | 38 comments)
16. Iron Mountain: It's Time to Talk About Hard Drives (59 points | 54 comments)
17. Multispectral Imaging and the Voynich Manuscript (96 points | 21 comments)
18. DJI Neo review – a drone that can do everything, and land in your hand (18 points | 5 comments)
19. Microwave Oven Failure: Spontaneously turned on by its LED display (36 points | 7 comments)
20. Git Bash Is My Preferred Windows Shell (3 points | discuss)
21. Roame (YC S23) Is Hiring a Chief of Staff ( | hide)
22. Lip Reading as a Service (Read Their Lips by Symphonic Labs) (15 points | 7 comments)
23. Show HN: GitOps Template for Kubernetes (48 points | 19 comments)
24. Show HN: Free tool to find RSS feeds, even if not linked on the page (91 points | 37 comments)
25. Deductive Verification for Chain-of-Thought Reasoning in LLMs (25 points | 2 comments)
26. How to Compose Math Problems (39 points | 3 comments)
27. Pixhell Attack: Leaking Info from Air-Gap Computers via 'Singing Pixels' (8 points | discuss)
28. New York Times tech workers union votes to authorize a strike (175 points | 150 comments)
29. Don't defer Close() on writable files (2017) (220 points | 246 comments)
30. ChartEye: A Deep Learning Framework for Chart Information Extraction (23 points | discuss)
